Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.cli.match_data

Class Board

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.cli.match_data.Board
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Board()
    This constructor initialize the board rep by instantiating a matrix of #(rows * columns) Cell instances.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean areAdjacent​(java.awt.Point p1, java.awt.Point p2)
    This method checks if two points can be considered adjacent.

    This method returns all the adjacent position to the given one (excluded itself).
    java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getAdjacentPoints​(java.awt.Point point, boolean considerEquals)
    This method returns all the adjacent position to the given one (included itself).
    Cell getCell​(java.awt.Point pos)
    This method returns an instance of Cell given its position on the board.
    static int getColumns()
    Getter for the board's columns
    int getNumberOfWorkers()
    This method returns the current number of workers on the board.
    java.util.Map<java.awt.Point,​java.util.List<BuildingType>> getPossibleBuildings​(java.lang.String worker, java.util.Map<java.awt.Point,​java.util.List<BuildingType>> currentBuilds, java.util.Map<BuildingType,​java.lang.Integer> buildingsCounter)
    This method returns a map of possible buildings to build by the given worker and also excludes the ones that have been already built or the ones who have their counter set to zero.

    Getter for the board's rows

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      This constructor initialize the board rep by instantiating a matrix of #(rows * columns) Cell instances.

  • Method Details

    • getRows

      public static int getRows()
      Getter for the board's rows
      Returns:
      the number of rows.

    • getColumns

      public static int getColumns()
      Getter for the board's columns
      Returns:
      the number of columns.

    • getNumberOfWorkers

      public int getNumberOfWorkers()
      This method returns the current number of workers on the board. It is used in the setting of initial workers' position in order to display the GraphicalBoard if the number of workers on the board is 0.
      Returns:
      the number of workers on the board.

    • getWorkerPosition

      public java.awt.Point getWorkerPosition​(java.lang.String worker)
      This method returns the position of the given worker on the board.
      Parameters:
      worker - is the String containing the id of the requested worker.
      Returns:
      a Point which is the actual worker's position on the board.

    • resetWorkers

      public void resetWorkers()
      This method removes all the worker on the board. It is used when a PacketUpdateBoard is received and thus the new workers' position should be set.

    • getCell

      public Cell getCell​(java.awt.Point pos)
      This method returns an instance of Cell given its position on the board.
      Parameters:
      pos - is the position of the Cell on the board.
      Returns:
      an instance of Cell.

    • areAdjacent

      public boolean areAdjacent​(java.awt.Point p1, java.awt.Point p2)
      This method checks if two points can be considered adjacent.
      Parameters:
      p1 - is the first point to check.
      p2 - is the second point to check.
      Returns:
      true if p2 and p2 are adjacent, false otherwise.

    • getAdjacentPoints

      public java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getAdjacentPoints​(java.awt.Point point)
      This method returns all the adjacent position to the given one (excluded itself).
      Parameters:
      point - is the position to check.
      Returns:
      a list of adjacent positions to point.

    • getAdjacentPoints

      public java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getAdjacentPoints​(java.awt.Point point, boolean considerEquals)
      This method returns all the adjacent position to the given one (included itself).
      Parameters:
      point - is the position to check.
      considerEquals - is true if the position should be considered adjacent to itself, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      a list of adjacent positions to point.

    • getPossibleBuildings

      public java.util.Map<java.awt.Point,​java.util.List<BuildingType>> getPossibleBuildings​(java.lang.String worker, java.util.Map<java.awt.Point,​java.util.List<BuildingType>> currentBuilds, java.util.Map<BuildingType,​java.lang.Integer> buildingsCounter)
      This method returns a map of possible buildings to build by the given worker and also excludes the ones that have been already built or the ones who have their counter set to zero.
      Parameters:
      worker - is the String containing the workerID to check.
      currentBuilds - is a map of the already chosen buildings.
      buildingsCounter - counter of the available buildings
      Returns:
      a map that associates adjacent positions to the worker with the possible buildings that can be built by it.
